text.title: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment

head.s: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment

p.s: Apartment-living is an attractive option for seniors who no longer need a big family home , or want to get the most out of their retirement savings by reducing extra costs .
But downsizing your home does n’t prevent you from throwing successful family parties in your apartment !
With simple planning , you can still bring everyone home for the holidays .

item.s: Plan your space .
Furnish your apartment with pieces that serve multiple purposes .
Stools and pillows look great and can be used for extra seating .
Tables that fold or expand can temporarily double your serving space .

figure.rend: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment Step 1 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Clear the Clutter .
Put away any knickknacks , counter clutter , and small decorative furniture .
Your valuables will not only be safe , but you will have more surface space and the room will seem bigger and more inviting .

figure.rend: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment Step 2 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Delegate .
Once your children have grown out of calling peanut butter and pickles a dinner , ask them to help with the preparations !
If each adult prepares an appetizer , desert or entrée , your preparation time will be cut significantly , your kitchen will stay cleaner and everyone will be able to contribute to the day .

figure.rend: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment Step 3 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Make after-party arrangements .
Are people coming from out of town ?
Will alcohol be served ?
Is transportation available ?
If any of your guests will need overnight accommodation , make sure arrangements are made before the big day .
A smaller home means less space for unexpected overnight guests .

figure.rend: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment Step 4 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Do n't forget the children .
If children are coming , make sure there is a safe space away from the excitement of the party available .
In an apartment , a bedroom or office can be used for this purpose .
Young children may become overwhelmed or tired before the day is through and having a ' children 's only ' area will make sure that they enjoy the day as much as the adults .

figure.rend: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment Step 5 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Eat simply .
Unless you are planning a formal dinner , serve simple food that wo n't stain clothes .
If everyone ca n't fit around a single table , skip the dinner time ordeal and allow your guests to mingle and graze the food .

figure.rend: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment Step 6 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Watch the clock .
Know when your guests are coming and leaving .
If your first guest arrives early and the last guest leaves late , the day can quickly become long and overwhelming .
Set a start and finish time for your gathering and you and your guests will get the most out of your time with each other .

figure.rend: Accommodate Guests in Your New Apartment Step 7 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Moving into a rented apartment does n't mean you have to give up your family traditions .
With just a bit of planning , you can still find room to accommodate everyone when celebrating family occasions .
Welcome your guests with a drink and offer to take any coats or bags .
This will help them feel more comfortable and integrate with the party sooner .
Save a room for coats and bags , such as a spare bedroom .
This will help your guests feel more safe that their belongings are n't next to the door .
If your guests have n't met before the party , introduce them to the others as they enter .
Have a list of taxi companies on standby for your guests leaving after consuming alcohol .
Do n't be afraid to cool the party down .
When it 's getting late and you feel the party should come to an end , politely tell them that they should think about how they 're going to get home .
It 's your home after all !
